title: Sri Lankans to witness rare ‘Blood Moon’ tonight
byline: Sri Lankans will have the rare opportunity to witness a spectacular ’Blood Moon’ tonight (7), Professor Chandana Jayaratne, Head of the Department of Physics at the University of Colombo and Chairman of the Arthur C. Clarke Institute for Modern Technologies, said.

title: GSMB suspends sand transport during school hours after fatal crash
byline: The Geological Survey and Mines Bureau (GSMB) has suspended the transportation of sand during school hours with effect from last Thursday (4), following a fatal collision between a school van and a lorry in Dummalasooriya, Kuliyapitiya.

title: Ella bus tragedy: Driver’s blood samples sent for tests
byline: The blood samples of the driver of the excursion bus that plunged into a thousand-foot ravine in the Rawana Ella Reserve, killing 15 people and injuring 18 others, will be sent to the Government Analyst today (7) for further testing, Ella Police said.

title: Sinner vs Alcaraz at US Open: A rivalry tennis fans cannot miss
byline: September 7 - The spotlight of world tennis falls on New York tonight, where Italy’s Jannik Sinner, ranked No. 1 in the world, takes on Spain’s Carlos Alcaraz, the world No. 2, in the men’s singles final of the US Open.

title: Japan’s embattled Prime Minister Ishiba to resign, media report
byline: Japan’s Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has expressed his intention on Sunday to step down following growing calls from his party to take responsibility for a historic defeat in July’s parliamentary election, Japan’s NHK public television reported.

title: Sri Lanka vs Zimbabwe:Decisive 3rd T20I clash in Harare today
byline: The thrilling three-match T20I series between Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe will reach its climax today (September 7) with the decisive third and final T20 International at the Harare Sports Club. The match is set to begin at 5:00 p.m. local time.

title: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath heads for Geneva
byline: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath left for Geneva this morning (7) to participate in the 60th session of the United Nations Human Rights Council, which begins tomorrow (8), the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said.

title: Explosives unearthed at Middeniya Meth chemicals site
byline: Police recovered a cache of explosives and ammunition from a site in Middeniya Thalawa, Hambantota, where chemicals used for manufacturing Crystal methamphetamine were previously discovered.

title: Russian vaccine for colon cancer ready to use: Report
byline: Russia’s cancer vaccine has successfully completed preclinical trials, demonstrating both safety and high efficacy, Veronika Skvortsova, head of the Federal Medical and Biological Agency (FMBA), announced at the Eastern Economic Forum (EEF), Tass reported.

title: Chemicals suspected for ‘Ice’ production seized in Tangalle
byline: Tangalle Police recovered a stock of chemicals suspected to be used in the production of the drug ‘Ice’ during a special raid in Netolpitiya, Tangalle, this morning (07).

title: SLPP to take action over governments smear campaigns: Namal
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) said it will not remain tolerant of continuous smear campaigns carried out by the current government and will not allow such practices to continue in the future.

title: Crackdown on vehicles with illegal modifications from tomorrow
byline: The government will begin strict enforcement of the law against vehicles operating with dangerous and unauthorised modifications from tomorrow (07), Deputy Transport Minister Dr. Prasanna Gunasena announced.

title: Forest fire reported in Ratnapura
byline: A fire has been reported on land belonging to the Forest Conservation Department in the Kongasthenna Grama Niladhari Division, located on the border of the Weligepola and Balangoda Divisional Secretariats in Ratnapura, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said

title: Verstappen puts brakes on McLaren with record-breaking Italian GP victory
byline: Max Verstappen slowed McLaren’s Formula One dominance on Sunday with a phenomenal display of driving on his way to victory at the Italian Grand Prix, the fastest ever race in the sports history.

title: No space for underworld to re-emerge: Minister Vidyarathna
byline: There is no room for the underworld to re-emerge in Sri Lanka, as the corrupt politics that once sustained it has come to an end, Plantations and Community Development Minister Samantha Vidyarathna said.

title: A record-breaking success
byline: In an outstanding display of skill and determination, S. Thomas’ College achieved a historic milestone on their 2025 UK cricket tour by winning all six matches played, a record achievement in the school’s cricketing history.

title: OPEC+ agrees further oil output boost from October to regain market share
byline: OPEC+ has agreed to further raise oil production from October as its leader Saudi Arabia pushes to regain market share, while slowing the pace of increases compared with previous months due to an anticipated weakening of global demand.

title: “Kala Wewa back to the elephants” project restores elephant habitats
byline: The “Kala Wewa Back to the Elephants” project, conducted in line with the Clean Sri Lanka initiative, was successfully implemented over three days in the floodplains surrounding the Kala Wewa National Park, the President’s Media Division (PMD) announced.

title: Israeli foreign minister calls for Hamas’ surrender as military pounds Gaza
byline: Israel again called on Hamas to surrender on Sunday, as the military carried out strikes on Gaza’s largest urban centre where hundreds of thousands of Palestinians are seeking shelter.

title: Mishara’s 73 powers Sri Lanka to series victory over Zimbabwe
byline: Sri Lanka clinched the three-match T20I series against Zimbabwe with a dominant eight-wicket win in the decisive third match at the Harare Sports Club on Sunday (7).

title: Pope Leo XIV declares 15-year-old computer whiz, a saint
byline: Pope Leo XIV declared a 15-year-old computer whiz the Catholic Church’s first millennial saint on Sunday (September 7, 2025), giving the next generation of Catholics a relatable role model who used technology to spread the faith and earn the nickname “God’s influencer.”

title: UNP shedding ties with People’s Alliance is fake
byline: The story which is being carried under a United National Party (UNP) letter-head that the party is shedding ties with the People’s Alliance is fake, an official statement from the party said today.

title: Pakistan to host maiden T20I tri-series involving Afghanistan and Sri Lanka
byline: The Pakistan Cricket Board will host its maiden T20I tri-series when Pakistan, Afghanistan and Sri Lanka feature in a three-nation tournament from 17 to 29 November.

title: Russian vaccine for colon cancer ready to use: Report
byline: Russia’s cancer vaccine has successfully completed preclinical trials, demonstrating both safety and high efficacy, Veronika Skvortsova, head of the Federal Medical and Biological Agency (FMBA), announced at the Eastern Economic Forum (EEF), Tass reported.

title: Japan’s embattled Prime Minister Ishiba to resign, media report
byline: Japan’s Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has expressed his intention on Sunday to step down following growing calls from his party to take responsibility for a historic defeat in July’s parliamentary election, Japan’s NHK public television reported.
